Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Pilley Lane, Leckhampton, Cheltenham

item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Bafflingly insufficient repair left dangerous cracks in cycleway, 12th October
item.description:
The shared cycleway and footpath that runs from Liddington Road to the Premier Inn Barnwood. The previous repair only addressed a small proportion of the cracking, leaving the vast majority of cracks that could trap a road bike wheel and cause an accident. There are patches of wide cracks along the *entire length* of this path.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedgerow in parking area of evergreen walk, 12th October
item.description:
Two chairs, basketball hoop and food bin have all been dumped in hedgerow. They have been there since August

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evergreen Walk, Longlevens, Gloucester

item.category: Flytipping (not witnessed and no evidence likely)

item.title: The potholes have just been repaired, for the umpteenth time, and because they were not done properly, there is already water pooling in and they will need to be done again in a couple of months. Why the whole area either side of the ford can’t be done properly without continuously patching up the potholes?, 12th October
item.description:
Between the ford and the postbox

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sevenhampton, Cotswold

item.title: Bus shelter discussing state, 12th October
item.description:
Shelter on corner of Winchester Way + Salisbury Ave. Badly needs cleaning. Why is the now disused shelter by St Christopher Church still being washed down, while this one has not been done for years??
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Several potholes on the corner both sides of the road, 12th October
item.description:
The location is the bend in the road just past the farm on the left hand side going up the hill. There are potholes on both the left and right of the site and both further down and up of the marker. This means avoidance both up and down Aggs Hill puts vehicles in the middle of the road - which is quite busy currently as traffic is avoiding the closure on the A40. Please can these be filled in
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aggs Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous tree infected with Ash dieback, 11th October
item.description:
The tree is on the Cotswold way oath behind my house (Grafton House) and the tall tree looks like it could fall over our house.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Street, Brockworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Volunteer litter pick bags ready for collection, 11th October
item.description:
Lay-by on the A40 between Wheatstone Inn and Liddington Road (before you go under the railway bridge) next to the litter bin. The 'What 3 Words' location is herb.closer.salad The ordnance survey map reference is: 51.87699, -2.197851 Council Litter Bin Ref: 0304

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Litter picking bags ready for collection

item.title: 2 problems. 1) grown so large the telephone/internet wires are in the branches. 2) overhanging branches have dropped onto car in high winds., 11th October
item.description:
Outside number 29 the grove. Affects others due to telephone and internet lines going through tree up to next post in street. Now so large Fallen branches have dropped on cars on the drive in high winds. In previous years tall overgrown trees on the same street have been cut down and replaced with smaller trees types.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, The Grove, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: All of a sudden (last 6 months) ? Road is sinking, 11th October
item.description:
Not a pothole. This section of the road (opposite "Berry's Bunny's" is somehow sinking. It is definately getting worse. I avoid it because at all costs - it nearly bottoms my suspension out on my new Golf ! There is one way around it on the Left side, but it is dangerously close to the grass kerb. Key thing... It was not there until recently... now deteriorating.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned sofa cushion on Kings Road, 11th October
item.description:
Top end of Kings Road, by princes street junction, there is an abandoned sofa cushion. Not a large fly tip, but needs collecting

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Kings Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
